techmeme.title: Meta creates a free, "fully funded" curriculum to teach middle schoolers how to recognize forms of online exploitation, in partnership with nonprofit Childhelp (Emma Roth/The Verge)
A look at ACTS 17, a nonprofit devoted to introducing Christianity to technologists by inviting Peter Thiel and other tech executives to talk about their faith (Emma Goldberg/New York Times)
Andesite, which combines human expertise and AI in its security operations center platform, raised an additional $23M seed, taking its total funding to $38.25M (David DiMolfetta/Nextgov/FCW)
Apple now lets users migrate apps, music, books, shows, and movies between Apple accounts, but the feature isn't available to users in the EU, the UK, or India (Juli Clover/MacRumors)
Super Micro forecasts FY 2026 revenue above est. and is "confident" it will file its delayed annual report by the Feb. 25 deadline; SMCI jumps 7%+ after hours (Samantha Subin/CNBC)
